post_text:
As we begin our school year off with remote learning, here are a few things to consider as you prep an at-home workspace. Having a designated workspace will encourage your children to be productive and stay on track.

Tips for at home workspace:

-Includes a clutter-free, flat work surface
-Is relatively distraction-free
-Has plenty of light
-Is free from technology unrelated to school

Español:

Al comenzar nuestro año escolar con aprendizaje a la distancia, aquí hay algunas cosas que considerar al preparar el area de estudio en casa. Designar una lugar de estudio le animará a sus hijos a tener un día más productivo y a mantenerse al corriente con sus trabajos y actividades escolares.

Sugerencias para el area de estudio en casa:

- Escoger una area limpia, plana, amplia, con
suficiente espacio libre de objetos y
obstrucciones.
- Relativamente libre de distracciones.
- Suficientemente alumbrada.
- Libre de dispositivos electrónicos no
requeridos para uso escolar.

To make the at home learning experience easier for our parents, we have provided a few great resources on our website. There is easy access to links with instructions on helping you find your child's username in Skyward, the steps to log your student into their Chromebook, and more.

Link to resources: https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1282167

Español:

Para facilitar la experiencia del aprendizaje en casa para los padres, les hemos proporcionado algunos recursos en nuestra página de internét. Ahí encontrará acceso fácil a enlaces con instrucciones en cómo encontrar el nombre de usuario de sus hijos para Skyward, pasos para acceder el dispositivo Chromebook de sus hijos y mucho más.

Enlace a los recursos: https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1282167

If you are a parent who is unfamiliar with Google Classroom we want to help make your experience easier to navigate. Here is an easy-to-follow guide to show you how to log in and operate Google Classroom.

Link: https://4.files.edl.io/5fba/08/11/20/130724-f6a6284c-9080-4bcc-b3ef-8380f4427625.pdf

post_text:
George Washington Middle School and Pillars Community Health are partnering together to provide a parent cafe regarding talking to kids about race & racism. All SD103 parents/guardians are welcome to join the conversation on June 22, 2020 @ 7pm via ZOOM (for English speakers).

ZOOM ID: 813 5203 3852
Online URL: https://tinyurl.com/GWracism
By Phone: (312) 626-6799

*Español*

La escuela George Washington Middle School y la organización comunitaria Pillars Community Health se han asociado para ofrecer un taller "parent cafe" en linea para padres/guardianes de cómo hablar con sus hijos sobre raza y el racismo.

Todos los padres y guardianes del distrito escolar, SD103, son bienvenidos a participar en la conversación de estos temas en Español este próximo Lúnes, 22 de Junio del 2020 a las 6pm por la aplicación de video en linea: ZOOM.

ZOOM ID: 885 2801 9426
En Linea: https://tinyurl.com/GWRacismo
Por Teléfono: (312) 626-6799

post_text:
We are currently hiring nurses for the 2020-2021 school year. This exciting opportunity to work with the great students of our District also comes with a few perks, including:

1. Excellent Hours
2. Follows School Year Calendar
3. Benefits

If you or someone you know is interested contact Colleen Bergren, Director of Student Services at bergrenc@sd103.com or visit our website at www.sd103.com for more information.

post_text:
Today is your last day to make your opinion heard. The Speak Up initiative from Project Tomorrow and District 103 have partnered together to give parents the opportunity to give your input about technology use in your student's life and help your child's school choose the right technology for their classroom. The survey can be completed at https://speakup.tomorrow.org/.

Responses are secure and confidential.

Avoid the summer learning loss slide! Lyons School District 103 students will have free full access to our learning platforms throughout the summer for both Reading and Math!

To register visit: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdFS3CBsXNkKTZf7wNpBaJKDx-Z0Mpaj3Ojoq3BdAUQY0hCPw/viewform

Para registrarse: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdFS3CBsXNkKTZf7wNpBaJKDx-Z0Mpaj3Ojoq3BdAUQY0hCPw/viewform

post_text:
Today is the first day of Teacher Appreciation Week. I have never been more proud of our teachers than I have been during the suspension of in-person learning. Our teachers have gone above and beyond to ensure that our students are continuing to receive a quality education.

To our teachers, your hard work and dedication to our students’ success is inspiring. I am honored and grateful for the opportunity to work beside each of you.

THANK YOU!

Kristopher Rivera
Superintendent

*Español*

Hoy es el primer día de la Semana de Apreciación del Maestro. Nunca he estado más orgulloso de nuestros maestros que durante la suspensión del aprendizaje en persona. Nuestros maestros han hecho todo lo posible para garantizar que nuestros estudiantes continúen recibiendo una educación de calidad.

Para nuestros maestros, su trabajo y dedicación al éxito de nuestros estudiantes inspira. Me siento honrado y agradecido por la oportunidad de trabajar junto a cada uno de ustedes.

¡GRACIAS!

Kristopher Rivera
Superintendente

post_text:
Schools are open to serve breakfast and lunch throughout the duration of the mandated closure. Parents/guardians can pick up breakfast & lunch for all children 18 years and younger between the hours of 10 a.m. and 12 p.m. at the school closest to your home. Information on the pick-up location at each school can be found on our website, https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1188537.

*Español*

Las escuelas están abiertas sirviendo desayuno y almuerzo durante la duración del cierre obligatorio. Padres/Guardianes pueden pasar a recoger el desayuno y almuerzo para sus hijos entre los horarios de 10 a.m. y 12 p.m. a la escuela más cercana a su hogar. Información detallada sober la úbicación para recoger la comida de cada escuela se puede encontrar en nuestra página electrónica:
https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1188537

post_text:
Are you having trouble navigating your child's school technology? We're here to help! Visit the technology support page on our website at https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1205007 for assistance with:

-Student login and passwords

-Chromebook or Clever login

-Viewing your child’s 3rd Quarter Report Card

Still have questions? Feel free to email one of our technology team members at tech103@sd103.com.

*Español*

Está teniendo dificultad usando la tecnología de la escuela de sus hijos? ¡Estamos aquí para ayudarle! Visite nuestra página de apoyo técnico aquí: https://www.sd103.com/apps/news/article/1205007 para asistencia con lo siguiente:

- Início de sesión estudiantíl y contraseñas.

- Início de sesiónes de Chromebook o Clever.

- Acceso a las calificaciones del 3er trimestre de sus hijos.

Aún tiene preguntas? Mánde un correo electrónico a uno de nuestros miembros del equipo de tecnologia al: tech103@sd103.com

post_text:
As adults it’s important that we understand how to support our children during this pandemic. That’s why we’re hosting a Parent Cafe to discuss strategies parents/guardians can use to support their child and themselves while school buildings are closed.

There is a scheduled time for both English & Spanish speakers to join in the conversation:

English - Wednesday, April 22nd at 7 p.m.
Spanish - Friday, April 24th at 10 a.m.

Parents/Guardians can participate two different ways:

1. Computer - https://meet.google.com/xcu-smjz-nav
2. Phone - 1 478-239-2128 PIN: 285 504 161#

post_text:
Hello District 103! We are very excited to officially launch our district Facebook page. This page was created to inform parents, staff, and community members about our achievements, events, news and activities. Our District is working hard to maintain and develop new lines of communication among the communities we serve. My hope is that you find this page and its information to be engaging and valuable.

Thank You,
Kristopher Rivera - Superintendent

*Español*

Hola Distrito 103! Estamos muy emocionados de lanzar oficialmente nuestra página de Facebook del distrito. Esta página fue creada para informar a los padres, el personal y los miembros de la comunidad sobre nuestros logros, eventos, noticias y actividades. Nuestro distrito está trabajando arduamente para mantener y desarrollar nuevas líneas de comunicación entre las comunidades a las que servimos. Espero que esta página y su información le resulten interesantes y valiosas.

Gracias,
Kristopher Rivera - Superintendente
